text: Profit First accounting for solo founders: cash buckets, owner's pay, runway discipline
One-hour ops: daily cadence to ship, automate, and reduce operational drag
Design a simple lead magnet that filters ICP and drives weekly conversations
Build a pricing ladder: starter, core, premium; anchor on outcome not effort
Sharpen your niche: one persona, one painful outcome, one clear promise
Owner calendar: protect deep work blocks, compress meetings, batch decisions
Ops scorecard: weekly metrics for pipeline, cash, churn, cycle time
Handoff cadence: standardize client updates; reduce ambiguity with clear next steps
Service blueprint: map stages, artifacts, SLAs; eliminate hidden work
Agency minimums: set floor fees, scope guardrails, kill scope creep politely
Solo power hour: outreach, follow-ups, proposals—no tools, just reps
Proposal library: templatize outcomes, risks, schedule; reuse and refine
Weekly demo: show real progress, capture next commitment, prevent drift
Decision log: record context, options, tradeoffs; avoid re-litigating
Accountability loop: set commitments, track, review; remove wiggle room
Cash sweep routine: move surplus to runway and taxes every Friday
Ops drills: practice escalations, backups, and restores before they matter
Churn math: reduce cancellations by clarifying value and closing feedback loops
Scope guardrails: define done, change policy, and response windows
Client onboarding: checklist, kickoff deck, mutual plan, first win
Waitlist discipline: cap capacity, maintain scarcity, protect quality
Email cadence: weekly teaching with CTA; short, specific, useful
Weekly planning: pick three outcomes, kill distractions, block time
Offer matrix: map pains to outcomes; pick one flagship, one upsell
Retainer shape: define rhythm, artifacts, checkpoints, exit criteria
Ops checklists: step-by-step tasks for repeatability; store in plain text
Meeting compression: halve duration, write pre-reads, decide in doc
After-action review: what happened, why, fixes, next play
Tradeoffs talk: frame choices with constraints; pick a path and commit
ICP clarity: one sentence test—who, pain, outcome, proof
Docs as product: living SOPs that reduce errors and speed onboarding
Runway math: expenses, burn, margin; decide now, not later
Tail risk: identify black swans; add tiny protections early
Ops radar: watch leading indicators; act before fires start
Ops inventory: list workflows; automate the boring parts first
Feedback loop: ask for proof of value weekly; adjust scope fast
Proposal clarity: problem, outcome, plan, proof, price—no fluff
Calendar cleanup: delete recurring noise; create maker mornings
Owner ops: ship, sell, learn—repeat; avoid tool rabbit holes
Content system: 3 posts per week from real client stories
Weekly 1:1: short, specific, next move; no status theater
SLAs that bite: define response times; enforce with polite scripts
OKRs lite: 1 objective, 3 key results; update Friday
Ops budget: small tools, high leverage; kill subscriptions quarterly
Handoff checklist: ready-to-run artifacts; zero ambiguous steps
Escalation path: who, when, how; practice before chaos
Client wins: collect testimonials; ship proof, not adjectives
Agency differentiation: one unfair advantage; show it in case studies
Operating rhythm: Monday plan, Wed ship, Fri review
Owner boundaries: protect energy, say no, enforce scope
